s.text: If you buy that, you must still be living in the '50s, or whenever it was that we last took what politicians said at face value.
This is what's really wrong with his character--the manipulator who thinks that his personal ends justify just about any means, no matter how unprincipled.
This is what's really wrong with his character--the manipulator who thinks that his personal ends justify just about any means, no matter how unprincipled.
It's a nasty, muggy morning where I am, the worst of both seasons: dark as only fall mornings can be, but still as humid as summer.
